page.title: 20County Council Elections
page.content: Thursday, 2nd May, 1985, was the day for the County Council Elections. Candidates for the Clee Hill Area were Mr. Reiner for the Conservative Party, Major Coles, an Independent Conservative, and Mr. Allen for the Labour Party. Posters had been up in the area for a few weeks. We went to the Polling Station at the Parish Hall and talked to a man called Mr. Heath, who helped old people to come and vote then took them back home again. We spoke to Mr.Reiner who said that if he was elected he would make this area a better place. He said we couldn't go inside unless we were with our parents. The votes went to Ludlow to be counted and the results were announced the following day. Major Coles was re_elected.
